data.title: Unified MiniYaml Color Syntax
data.body:
Currently, MiniYaml parses `Color` using [a]rgb format and `HSLColor` using hsl[a] format.
They should be one of these:
- _red_ `,` _green_ `,` _blue_ [`,` _alpha_]
- _hue_ `,` _saturation_ `,` _lightness_ [`,` _alpha_]
- Either by prefix:
  - `hsl,` _hue_ `,` _saturation_ `,` _lightness_ [`,` _alpha_]
  - `rgb,` _red_ `,` _green_ `,` _blue_ [`,` _alpha_]

data.title: Fix padding at the top of the cnc map chooser.
data.body: The map tabs were not connected to the main scrollpanel, which was 1px too low.

data.title: OpenRA.Utility.exe Color Picker
data.body:
Parse in the form _base_color_ `,` _saturation_ `,` _lightness_ `,` _alpha_ and output rgb[a]/hsl[a].
Where:
- _base_color_ is one of:
  - `rgb` `,` _red_ `,` _green_ `,` _blue_
  - [`hsl` `,`] _hue_ : HSL (hue, saturation, lightness) values (_hue_, 255, 255)
  - _knownColor_ : parsed by `Enum<KownColor>.TryParse` (See System.Drawing.KnownColor)
- _saturation_ is multiplied by _base_color_ saturation to get the final saturation (colourfulness - 0 is grey)
- _lightness_ is multiplied by _base_color_ lightness to get the final lightness (brightness - 0 is black)
- _alpha_ is the opacity/alpha channel

Options for shortening:
- Default missing to 255 filling from alpha. Ex: `Blue, 127` is blue with 50% opacity/alpha
  - This would allow for using rgba semantics like `rgb, 0, 0, 255, 127` to represent blue with 50% opacity/alpha
- Default empty to 255. Ex: `Blue, , , 127` is blue with 50% opacity/alpha
  - The number of components is more deterministic

Since there have been remarks about the HSL used by OpenRA being counterintuitive, this might help:
- Component text: _numerator_ `/` _denominator_
  - Component value = `255 *` _numerator_ `/` _denominator_
  - Except _hue_ is `256 *` _numerator_ `/` _denominator_
  - Allows for `hsl, 180/360, 50/100, 50/100`
- Component text: _percentage_ `%`

data.title: The game crashes on start up.
data.body:
OpenRA seems to crash on start up for me...

So far this is probably one of 3 things.

1.Windows 10 does not support OpenRA.

2.The version i use(Playtest 20150628)is not working for me.

3.My install is corrupted.

Crashlog from exception.log:
Mod Chooser Mod at Version playtest-20150628
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)

data.title: Remove producer-is-in-world assumptions from Production
data.body:
Justification:

> D2k upgrades need to be actors that never actor the world, produced by the PlayerActor, who is also not in the world, but the Production trait expects the producer to be in the world even if it has `Exit.MoveIntoWorld = False`, allowing the producees to not enter the world.

Use-case resides on @OmegaBolt's [d2k balancing branch](https://github.com/OmegaBolt/OpenRA).
Anything currently in bleed should work exactly the same as it does now.

data.title: Crates gets collected by paratroopers in the air
data.body:
Hey,
this might be a small one, but it looks wrong.
If you order a paratrooper over a crate, the crate will get picked up way before the paratroopers drop at the bottom.

data.title: Vehicle Move animation freeze after perform attack.
data.body:
I have test TS mod on bleed version of openra and try mod something on it but I notice this problem which not only happen on my unit but also effect with official unit like Wolverine.

Unit move animation work fine until I order him to attack then their move animation become freezing and can't recover for entire game. 

![img](http://i55.photobucket.com/albums/g152/Holy_Master/mastodon_glitch_zpsp0nvmqj9.gif)

[info]
- Unit still able to switch animation base on their activity .
- As if unit away stuck at first frame of move animation on each direction .
- My unit use similar code to Openra Wolverine.
- Wolverine also suffer from this glitch
- Not sure if Vehicle with turret also effect by this but Titan doesn't seem to effect with this bug..
- This bug not effect with Titan not sure if it effect only with non-turret vehicle.

data.title: Actor type 'camera.paradrop' does not define a quantized body orientation.
data.body: Got this exception on roughly day old bleed. No idea what may have caused it, I was just letting some AIs go nuts.

data.title: Equalize Soviet and Allies 'building' tab for easier hotkey configuration.
data.body:
Getting to know the hotkeys for buildings in RA is a little too hazardous if you switch between factions now and then. Hotkeys are now assigned to 'slots' and so could it not be an idea to give the factions an equal 'building' slot design? All the TD and D2K factions share the same 'building' slot design which invites the player to learn them faster.

The Soviet Kennel push the entire 'building' tab +1 spot off the Allies' design:
![buildtabs3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/9121143/b7b696f2-3c80-11e5-8fc9-73021c90629f.png)

Other tabs differs as well off course (defense, infantry etc.) but that doesn't look like trouble.

data.title: Replay hotkeys for pause/play/speed
data.body:
More convenience to an already damn good replay viewer. I'm looking through tons of replays searching for that special shot. A simple set for hotkeys (preferably customizable) would make the experience that much better. I think one hotkey for play/pause and one for increase/decrease speed would be the most convenient.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25447480-replay-hotkeys-for-pause-play-speed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.body: Creaters just do the function, and player can do the translate, menu and unit desciption.

data.title: disable beacon button if game is in single player mode
data.body:
Check to see if the game is in single player mode and if it is disable the beacon button.

Closes #8535

data.title: Makes map script error display more noticeable.
data.body:
The script error display in the ingame menu is now more noticeable. This PR does the following:
- Changes the text of Objectives tab button to Script Error if there was an error. And also flashes the button.
- Changes the title text color of error message from white to red.

Fixes #8962.

data.title: Fixed the RallyPoint trait for Tiberian Sun polish
data.body: The sprites are not hard-coded, but configurable, self-documented and partly optional. Makes it lint testable regarding sprites and also future palette references https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8749 as well.

data.title: Fixed neutral actors being visible in the All Players observer shroud mode
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8961.

data.title: Fixed red DropDown separator on black observer UI
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8960.

data.title: Lua exception dialog no longer works properly
data.body:
The PR that removed the forced end-game screen regressed our handling of script errors.

The game will now throw up the regular game menu when the script crashes, with the error message showing as plain text below the center panel tabs (which are visually more prominent, so make the error less obvious).  The player can return to the game which then remains paused with no obvious indication why.

The return to game button should be disabled if the game was ended due to a script error, and the briefing tab should be hidden so that the error message takes priority.

data.title: Actors belonging to the Neutral player reveal fog and shroud for spectators
data.body: Happens when you select the "All Players" visibility option, and my guess is it's pretty new.
